name: Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel

reviews.text: The staff of this hotel are extremely caring and professional. We have only praise for the manager and his staff, they made our stay as comfortable as possible. The beds are comfy, the bathrooms clean, the internet fast, the movies as new as you can get, the room service excellent, the breakfast delicious. The location speaks for itself, so what more can you ask? We travelled with two very young and demanding guests who were treated like loyalty, merci beaucoup, see you soon!!!
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: This is a urban psicodelic hotel. The decoration makes it feel like going to a night club. The food is great, as usual in France. The service is good, nothing spetacular, as usual in Paris, however the staff is more friendly than average for the city. The location is great, just a few meters from the Arc de Triomphe.
reviews.title: Psicodelic
Hit and miss
reviews.text: We wanted to extend our trip for a few days more and I found a good rate at Renaissance and also wanted to check out what Marriott has to offer here comparing to other chain. I was fairly disappointed and don't think it's a true 5-star hotel, especially comparing to other hotels. Also it didn't help that I had no status with Marriott at that time, so no room upgrade to count on - the room was located in additional building at the back of the garden and was very small, even by Paris standards, but otherwise fairly modern and comfortable.
I don't think location was great either - you are close to Arc de Triomphe, but that's about it. Everything else is not in walking distance.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Spent three nights there with my husband and our two small children. The hotel is clean, the staff are very helpful, it has a great location and the food is great.
reviews.title: OK but didn't live up to our expectations based on previous reviews

reviews.text: The downside is that it was very expensive for what we got. The family room although it is supposed to be 35 sq mt felt very small and cramped. We payed 435 Euros a night and breakfast for some reason was not included in that price, wifi is at an extra cost and very expensive. Of the three nights we stayed there our sheets got changed once.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: Paris is a great city with many great hotels who offer more for the money we spent at the Renaissance.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located, close to the Arc, the metro and the Champs. The larger guest rooms are excellent and easily accommodates a family of 4. Staff are friendly and fully conversant in English. Cool room drops that varied nightly.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good selection of restaurants and fast food outlets within walking distance.
reviews.title: fantastique!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent six nights at this Renaissance at the end of March. This hotel truly cares about their guests. From the initial e mail from the hotel to our check out we could have not been more please with the hotel. All of their employees greated us whenever they saw us. We even got to the point that we could tease each other. It was so wonderful to return to the hotel after a long day on our feet and just be given a friendly smile and a greeting. The room was pleasant. It is large and we had the room to the rear with a balcony. We were very fortunate to have been in Paris when we could utilize the balcony. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel and found it very filling. The employees went out of their way to make our trip enjoyable and they exceeded all of our expectations. Thank you!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: We were in Paris on vacations, and choose a hotel with a good location, near from everything.
reviews.title: High level Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the check-in I bought an upgrade for a room with a view of Eiffel Tower. When arrived in the room, everything looked great, good space, good balcony, nice bath and an amazing view of the tower. The guy told me that all in the minibar was included in the price, he just forget to tell me that if I asked to refill the minibar within the same day, I'd be charged for each item. So, I ordered a sandwich for my daughter in the room service. When the food finally arrived, it was frozen and did not come with french fries, as the menu said. After this unfortunate incident on our arrival, the hotel's general manager sent me her apologies, as your boss that besides apologizing also sent some gifts for my daughter, because the sandwich was for her, and she slept hungry that night.
reviews.title: Best in Paris

reviews.text: The hotel itself has a very modern environment, the restaurant was reopened that week after the reforms, and it was fantastic. The breakfast served was simply unforgettable. Furthermore, the hotel is located in a busy area, central and safe, you can walk to almost anywhere, even at night. I understand that problems happen at any hotel, what differentiates this from others was the attitude of its leaders to really support and customer satisfaction.
reviews.title: Outstanding service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have nothing but positive comments for theis hotel. The food is amazing, beds are soft, everything works, and the people will go out of their way to make you comfortable. The bathroom is just big enough and and everything is clean. I have nothing bad to say. Try the French onion soup :)
reviews.title: Nice first trip to Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just down the road from the Arc de Triomphe. Short walk to the Arc, Champs Elysees and the Metro. We had a balcony but it's extremely small so don't expect to sit out on it while sharing a bottle of wine with your sweetie because two chairs won't fit! Don't get me wrong however, even a small balcony is better than no balcony. As others have said, they have issues with the air conditioning and I think they control the temperature and it certainly won't get as cool as americans want. None of these things should prevent you from staying here as it was a fine hotel. The staff was very helpful and there are numerous cafe's and restaurants nearby. We are platinum members so we got a free breakfast buffet each morning which has a wonderful selection of hot & cold items. We also received turn down service each night in which they left little hotel goodies (chocolates & hotel logo items). It was a nice touch!
reviews.title: Nice Modern Hotel with Great Location

reviews.text: I frequently stay Marriott family hotels and used points to stay here; it took many points plus an additional 80 euro/night - so it was not cheap.
reviews.title: A fabulous spot near everything with very helpful staff

reviews.text: From the beginning, the staff was very helpful in answering our emailed questions about the hotel, making dinner reservations and other tourist questions.
reviews.title: Good, but a little short of great
Very nice but expected excellent
reviews.text: There is no concierge level, which is disappointing. The breakfast is quite nice but expensive for what you get; I think it would be cost prohibitive for a family. My room faced the street on the 6th floor, so it was not high enough for a view; I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was even though it faces a fairly busy street. I was in an upgraded room with a large bed and room for a rollaway; it was large for a European city room. The furnishing were fairly new and tasteful. The room had many electrical plugs- which is a plus given all of the electronics everyone has now.
The hotel is in a very convenient location near tourist areas and the metro.
reviews.title: Great location and great service!

reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly situated on Avenue Wagram near restaurants that the whole family will enjoy and a wonderful street market around the corner with artisonal cheeses, sausages, fresh fruit, pastries, clothing and more! Our daughter left her jacket behind when we checked out and the maids saved it for her. You will not always find such trustworthy staff even at name hotels. By the way, get a room facing the avenue, the wall is one beautiful wavy window with the beautiful Paris light streaming in.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service

reviews.text: We enjoyed our say, the room was clean and beds were comfy. Very close to the Metro. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great hotel
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed here for five nights at the end of June as a solo traveler and this hotel was Paris Perfect! It was located close to the metro for easy sight seeing. Also the staff was great and they helped you get everywhere you needed...very easily in English. The hotel itself is very new and modern and VERY clean! I was very impressed how everything was so comfortable, clean and beautiful. The bathroom is very nice too. I highly suggest this place if you are traveling to Paris, you cant beat the location.
reviews.title: Perfect Paris Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay for two nights at this hotel. Found the hotel staff very friendly both at the desk and in the restaurant. We were upgraded from a mid floor room with a balcony to a room with a view of the Avenue Wagram . The room was nice but the bathroom only had a shower. I kept thinking was it really an upgrade, but I guess the view was an upgrade. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each morning and never realized that whether you ordered from the menu or ate the continental breakfast buffet, the charge was $30.00 per person. I had a bowl of Rice Krispies and 2 small muffins each morning. One morning, my husband ordered fried eggs over easy and they came sunny side up. When they realized, it was wrong they took it back in the kitchen and scrambled them beyond belief. Had we known they were $30 we would have complained. The hotel was very clean and all in all it was a good hotel.
reviews.title: Ultra Modern Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on points and enjoyed it very much. It was the tail end of a 3 week journey across Italy and France. Compared to most accomodations we experienced, this hotel was high up on the list for overall comfort and space. I believe we did have the upgraded room which included the upgraded (full size) soaps, lotions, shampoos as well as more than one unexpected special treat in our room. The location was excellent and the attendants/front desk could not have been more helpful. We only had 2 nights there and have to say we were quite disappointed to learn that we were relegated to the bar when we went down to dinner as they were having a private party in the dining room proper. That being said, we did not really have a proper dinner with a bottle of wine as planned, it just didn't seem worth spending a couple of hundred dollars in the bar setting. Breakfast was included and we found it to be satisfying with many selections although the host both days lacked a welcoming presence. Aside from that, this hotel has a lot going for it and we enjoyed it very much. Kudos to the bell boys, love your smiles!
reviews.title: New,clean, comfortable and well located

reviews.text: Jarring music, odd food (which, afterwards, another guest told me you could get cheaper by going on a French food discount website called the Fork and booking the same restaurant for a big discount!) and rooms that are really crying out for a lick of paint!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here for one week in December/January. This hotel is located a couple of short city blocks from the Arch de Triumph - down one of the streets that comprise the Etoile that surrounds the Arch. It was a quiet street, just far enough off the traffic and noise of the Champs Elysees. There is a Starbucks, McDonald's (free wifi), and several good restaurants between the hotel and the Arch. It was less than a 3 minute walk to the metro station. The hotel itself is typical Renaissance/Marriott - meaning clean, respectable, good quality service, etc. The rooms were big for a big city hotel. We never ate lunch or dinner in the restaurant, but the menu looked good, if expensive. (Continental breakfast was 22 euros per person, which is a lot for coffee or tea, juice, danishes, and cereal). The concierge was helpful and friendly. They sold us RER tickets and entrance tickets to Versailles and provided the usual maps and directions. They also recommended restaurants and sightseeing. The hotel room was furnished in a modern style, which was pretty and comfortable. No issues with water pressure, temperature, or anything like that. My daughter liked the evening service when they would bring a little treat or gift - some included candy, an Eiffel Tower key chain and a stuffed animal. We especially enjoyed walking home every evening after sightseeing. We would take the metro from wherever we ended up to the Place de Concorde and walk all the way up the Champs Elyssees from there to get home, even though the metro station at Charles de Gaulle Etoile (Arch de Triumph) was right there. The walk up the boulevard at night was an enjoyable way to end the day. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Most Recommended Romantic & Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from my first trip to Paris, and stayed at the wonderful Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel. First class experience, all the way. The rooms were roomy for any big city, even here in the states. I'm not a fan of the ultra modern decor but that's really a very minor point. The service was outstanding, and that's what matters! From the moment the bellboy opens the door for you, you are greeted warmly and attentively. The "navigator" - concierge, in the US - was so helpful. Restaurant recommendations, reservations made, simply instructions for getting around - nothing we asked went unanswered. The rooms were clean, maid service twice a day - first thing to do the heavy cleaning, then in the evening, turn down service along with another tidying up; nice little gifts every evening including a bottle of wine and chocolates upon arrival - all were exceptional! (I will say that we're Marriott platinum members so some of those goodies were probably because of that. Also, we were eligible for a free breakfast daily, which was extraordinary.)
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for a better experience!

reviews.text: The neighborhood was delightful - every time you leave the hotel, you see the Arc right up the street. Make sure, though, that you explore the streets further away from the Arc, as they're much less touristy. The Arc itself - and especially the Champs - is pretty hectic and full of tourists. But the near neighborhood is not. And the Metro (Charles de Gaulle Etoile stop) couldn't have been more convenient.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Renaissance Arc de Triomphe

reviews.text: We will most certainly return!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful service

reviews.text: We just came back from 3 glorious nights at this hotel. It was fabulous, in a great location (steps from Arc de Triomphe and Champ-Elysees). The service was impeccable, the rooms were beautiful, incredibly clean with wonderful amenities, and had a great bed/cot for our daughter all made up when we arrived. We would without a doubt stay here again and recommend it highly!
reviews.title: Family of Four--Nice and Safe!

reviews.text: This 3 year old hotel is the epitome of contemporary style and warm and caring service. It has a hip vibe without the snob appeal. We were welcomed back each time we entered. The concierges met us with a smile and were eager to help in any way they could.
reviews.title: Very chic hotel in the heart of Paris

reviews.text: As a Paris regular, I'm a great believer in a "change is as good as a rest" which is why I decided to try the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe hotel - and what a good choice it was. The first thing that strikes is you the stunning decor - you would think it was a one-off boutique hotel and not part of an international chain, It's very cool and very stylish but not the least bit stand-offish with a warm welcome which i was particularly impressed with. loved the lifts with the bright colour panels, The room was equally as attractive and I was lucky enough to have one with a fabulous terrace with breathtaking views of the city.
reviews.title: stylish and chic.

reviews.text: It's in a prime location - a short walk to the Champs Elysees - and it's unique style made it even more memorable, Lovely toileteries (Bulgari) and an excellent breakfast. Definitely one to go back to !Only thing that would have been good would have been a couple of English channels on the tv but thankfully i had my trust Ipad....
reviews.title: Great room and location

reviews.text: Everything is really close by this hotel. This was my first time to Paris and I took a EuroStar. It was a short taxi ride to the hotel. When I arrived the front desk invited me for breakfas (as it was almost over). There was a large selection of American and European selections, plus a choice of juices and omelettes. I knew there were a lot of tourist attractions within walking distance and I was able to easily find my way around. The staff was incredibly friendly. The concierge was patient and suggested several nice restaurants for lunch, even showed me the online menus - made the reservation too. Everyone spoke both English and French. The room, even by American standards, was spacious, very clean and modernly decorated. I had a beautiful view overlooking the courtyard. I only spent one night, but will be back.
reviews.title: Great location, amazing service, a little pricey -
Excellent
reviews.text: You can't get better service or location and still be a Marriott property. This hotel was first class all the way from the valet picking up your bags street side to the polite respectful front desk staff who really make you feel special. The room was spacious (by European standards) and clean but had the typical "no door" shower in many European hotel bathrooms. The room decor was tastefully done. The room cost was a bit pricey but let's face it, rooms are expensive in Paris.

Great location, and a great view from our room. Overlooks the Arc, and within a very short walk to Champs Elyssis. Very modern, inviting decor. The concierge was friendly, helpful. Very cool bar, and restaurant. Comfortable room. Really enjoyed our stay, and would like to return.
reviews.title: An amazing hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.text: About three or four blocks walk to the Arc de Triomphe and associated Metro station. Go the other direction on Wagram and you are in a more residential area with a daily market about four blocks away. Each room has a small balcony (one chair) and a huge bathroom. The bathroom features an open shower concept. You need to put towels down to keep the shower water from your feet at the sink--careful not to use an electrical appliance if you are standing in water! The bed was comfy and the curtains black out the room. The AC worked well and quietly. The staff were helpful both before and during our stay. Like many big city hotels, breakfast was WAY too expensive. The first morning we ate at Starbucks. After finding the market, we ate selections from there for the other two mornings. We used Marriott points and felt it was a good value for the points. We have recommended this hotel to friends who are going to Paris for the first time, as it is well located to a main Metro line and is large enough to offer services to make your visit stress-free (we bought reserved tickets at the hotel for the Musee d'Orsay which cut the queue time by at least half).
reviews.title: Modern hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one week-end in Paris in June 2011 and used our points to book a room in this hotel. The hotel is brand new and very luxurious. Our room was beautiful, spotless clean and well appointed, and just 5 ms walk to the Arc de triomphe and Champs Elysees. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great hotel in central location

reviews.text: For a short stay in Paris using points, this hotel is hard to beat. From CDG, took the RER B to Chatelet and the RER A to Charles de Gaulle Etiole. Up the steps to Wagram, turn left, two blocks and you're there. Easily walked or took metro to all major sites and districts in Paris. Beds comfy, with good AC and duvets, nice tub combo, helpful concierge.
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable rooms
Loved it
reviews.text: Our only complaint would be that the locks (both the security and the deadbolt) on the door were broken, and large crowbar marks could be seen on the doorframe. Didn't lend to a great sense of security, but hey, there's more danger from the pickpockets on the metro.

reviews.title: Did not meet my expectations
reviews.text: We had two rooms in our late June stay. This hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. I received very helpful personal emails the week before the stay. Once there the staff provided exemplary service. Cedric was particularly helpful in assisting us in navigating Paris and trying to save a few Euros here and there. The food is very good and the wait staff is very pleasant and helpful. A great location convenient to most of the must see things in Paris. A very comfortable choice. Everyone I spoke to had great English speaking skills, which I was not really expecting, but was very helpful to us. Rooms great. I recommend very highly.

reviews.title: Great stay, great location!

reviews.text: This hotel is commended for its excellent customer service!. From the pre arrival email notification including transportation options to the warm welcome by the receptionist and concierge team (Xavier and Cedric were knowledgeable, patient and thorough). The hotel was modern, rooms spacious (for Europe), clean and in the perfect location within a 5 minute walk to the Arc, Champs Elysees and metro. Good size bathroom with strong shower pressure (even a scale was provided) and very comfortable bed, a must after a long day of site seeing in this beautiful city. Large buffet breakfast offering although a bit pricey. Overall the staff were warm, welcoming and make you feel at home. The welcome bottle of wine and chocolates was a sweet surprise treat! Overall, great stay and I highly recommend this hotel with its top notch team.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!

reviews.text: This hotel was lovely. It was modern and tastefully decorated, was in a great location near all metros to get around the city easily, and had excellent support staff, particularly the concierge.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Just got back from a stay in Paris and this hotel is amazing. I was thoroughly pleased with every aspect. The location is terrific - just 2 blocks down from the Arc and the metro. The service and concierge (Chloe and Remi) were both great. The hotel is super clean, comfy beds, super nice rooms with plenty of space. We didnt even have one of the upgraded rooms but it had plenty of space and an awesome floor to ceiling window (wall to wall) that overlooked Wagram avenue and you could watch the Paris streets when you were back in the room. The room was super quiet!! We didnt hear a thing all night and slept like babies. The hotel is more "mod". So, if your looking for "old style" Parus ambiance then this isnt for you. But it had its own great ambiance and we just loved it. They told us there was a morning "continental" breakfast included (Gold level). I was expecting juice and rolls. However, it was the most complete and best spread we have seen on our European trips.Rows of hot food, all kinds of fresh fruit, coffees, rolls and croissants, cheeses etc...it was terrific. A few people have mentioned the smell from the restaurant when entering the building. Dont even think twice about that. It was nothing noticeable and I think they are being super picky by even mentioning that. It wasnt an issue - at all. Also, plenty of places to eat within 4 blocks in all directions..you cant go wrong - so many choices. I cant think of any negatives at all. I will stay here again when I come back to Paris!
reviews.title: Outstanding all the way around

description: The Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe designed by Christian de Portzamparc, is just a few steps away from the famous landmark and Champs-Elysées Avenue. A breathtaking contemporary design, this Arc de Triomphe, Paris hotel’s upscale guest rooms and suites are spacious and tastefully decorated and boast the latest in-room technology, including wireless Internet. After a long day of meetings or sightseeing, rejuvenate with a workout in the fitness center. Outstanding among hotels in Arc de Triomphe, Paris, guests can indulge in delightful dining at the Makassar Lounge Restaurant .
